header: The Vision of the Measuring Line

verse: Then I looked up. And I saw a man holding a line for measuring things.
I asked him, “Where are you going?”
Then the angel who was talking with me left. And another angel came out to meet him.
The second angel said to him, “Run and tell that young man this: ‘Jerusalem will become a city without walls because there will be so many people and cattle in it.
I will be a wall of fire around it,’ says the Lord. ‘And I will be the glory within it.’
“Hurry! Run away from Babylon. I have scattered you in all directions,” says the Lord.
“Hurry, people of Jerusalem! Escape from Babylon.”
This is what the Lord of heaven’s armies says: “Whoever hurts you hurts what is precious to me.”
“I will raise my hand against them. Their slaves will rob them.”
“Shout and be glad, Jerusalem. I am coming, and I will live among you,” says the Lord.
“At that time people from many nations will come to the Lord. And they will become my people. I will live among you. And you will know that the Lord of heaven’s armies has sent me to you.
Judah will be the Lord’s special part of the holy land. And Jerusalem will be his chosen city again.
Be silent, everyone. The Lord is coming out of the holy place where he lives.”
